Instruction:
Task Description: Create a WebSocket client class for interacting with Chrome DevTools Protocol, handling connection, message exchange, and disconnection events.

Class Description: The Chrome class is an EventEmitter that establishes and manages a WebSocket connection to Chrome's DevTools Protocol. It handles message parsing, error handling, and provides methods for sending commands and receiving responses/events.

Attributes:
- host: [String] - The host address for the WebSocket connection (default: 'localhost')
- port: [Number] - The port number for the WebSocket connection (default: 9222)
- secure: [Boolean] - Flag indicating whether to use secure WebSocket (wss)
- webSocketUrl: [String] - The complete WebSocket URL for connection
- _ws: [WebSocket] - The WebSocket instance
- _notifier: [EventEmitter] - External event notifier
- _callbacks: [Object] - Stores pending command callbacks
- _nextCommandId: [Number] - Tracks the next command ID

Methods:
- constructor(options, notifier) -> [void] - Initializes the Chrome instance with connection options and notifier
- _start() -> [Promise] - Internal method to initiate WebSocket connection
- _connectToWebSocket() -> [Promise] - Establishes WebSocket connection and sets up event handlers
- _handleConnectionClose() -> [void] - Cleans up when connection closes
- _handleMessage(message) -> [void] - Processes incoming WebSocket messages
- send(method, params, sessionId, callback) -> [Promise|void] - Sends a command to Chrome DevTools Protocol
- _enqueueCommand(method, params, sessionId, callback) -> [void] - Internal method to queue commands
- close(callback) -> [Promise|void] - Closes the WebSocket connection cleanly
